intro: Tarasa mandonii, commonly known as the Mandonii bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at moderate to high altitudes. It has slender stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
